Pre-visualisation, Cinematography, Production Design, Generative AI

In this module, students will understand the interlinked practicalities of working from short scripts they have written to pre-visualisation, cinematography, production design and generative AI. From their screenwriting they will develop narrative storyboards – including hand-drawn, captured and AI generated images, to live action and programme generated animatics. They will use motion capture as a pre-visualisation tool with examples drawn from contemporary production practice.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate the ability to conceptualise and produce film and media using pre-visualisation, cinematographic planning, production design and generative AI.

+  Apply knowledge of cinematography and production design to plan and visualise scenes using appropriate tools, including generative AI and motion capture.

+  Demonstrate understanding of professional practices, including project management, data logging, and ethical considerations surrounding AI and creative authorship in film production.

+  Reflect critically on the creative and technical decisions made during the pre-visualisation and production design process through annotated portfolios and collaborative critique.
